channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Elon Musk and Grok face ‘deeply troubling questions’from UK regulators over data use and consent
item.description: The UK government has launched a major investigation into Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot after it produced indecent deepfake images

item.title: Your browser wasn’t always a billboard — this free tool cuts the AI hype and gets back to the web
item.description: No more popups, AI nags, or shopping junk – Just The Browser gives you back your space

item.title: Tesla’s sales are plummeting, so it’s adding a cheaper all-wheel-drive Model Y in the US in a bid to drum up interest
item.description: Tesla adds a cheaper Model Y all-wheel-drive option to the line-up to help boost sales, but will it be enough for the failing brand?

item.title: Google’s Gemini 3 Release Won Over More Than 100 Million New Active Users
item.description: Gemini is coming for ChatGPT's crown.

item.title: The world's first 'biomimetic AI robot' just strolled in from the uncanny valley —and yes, it's super-creepy
item.description: A Shanghai startup has just revealed Moya, which it says is the first "biomimetic AI robot". But not everyone is convinced it's a good idea.

item.title: Walmart shopper reportedly buys Nvidia RTX 5080 at almost half-price — clearance aisle could be a way to beat GPU price hikes
item.description: With graphics cards getting more expensive – particularly high-end Nvidia models – these bargains are even more eye-opening.

item.title: Netflix Says if the HBO Merger Makes It Too Expensive, You Can Always Cancel
item.description: During a hearing at the US Senate, Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos said the company is working with the US government on guardrails against more price hikes.

item.title: Elon Musk Says ‘I Came to My Senses’ About Going to Epstein Island
Sam Altman got exceptionally testy over Claude Super Bowl ads
item.description: He posted a novella-sized rant that devolved into to calling his rival "dishonest" and "authoritarian."

item.title: ‘Someone is actually reading the room’: Firefox just got an AI kill switch, and I hope other developers will follow its lead
item.description: Firefox is adding an AI kill switch that lets users disable the AI features in its web browser.
